reviews.title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    I Named It “The Princess”
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2024
reviews.body: Overall the phone is fine and does everything I need for less money than an iPhone.But The Princess is very picky about phone chargers. She doesn’t like all the other phone chargers on Earth that charge every other make and model just fine.No, the Princess only likes HER wall charger. Luckily she doesn’t mind the USB that is integrated into a couple of outlets in our house. I haven’t asked her yet if she will tolerate my car charger.Seriously now, I plugged the phone into the the charger I have used for years and I got a message on the screen that it wasn’t good enough and charging would take 39 hours!! Yes. 3. 9. 39 hours. Bizarre. With two previous phones is was a few hours.So I will adapt to the special needs of The Princess and hope that I don’t need to start carrying with me, everywhere I go, her special charger.

reviews.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    This is not for USA
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2025
reviews.body: This is a pretty good phone. I noticed a lot of reviews are talking about it not really being unlocked, but it is. It's just international. That's why it starts off in another language and doesn't allow USA carriers. A lot of people seemed to have missed that part (myself included) and I wasted money buying phone plans for a phone that wasn't compatible. If you're reading this from the USA and thinking of ordering it or it's on the way, cancel it. The phone is great every other way but you won't be able to get a plan on it.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2024
reviews.body: I needed to replace my S20 Fe and didn't want to buy a expensive new galaxy again.This phone is functionally the same as the S20 Fe and has an improvement like placing the fingerprint sensor on the side button.It's not as fast but that's to be expected. It also has great battery life.This phone is almost perfect but it's buggy at times. Randomly the screen won't respond where you press it and it will not type the words you spell.Honestly feels like it's purposefully made not to preform as well as Samsungs more expensive phones to get people to spend more money.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2024
reviews.body: My wife needed a new phone so we searched for Boost Mobile phones and this phone popped up. We ordered and went to activate it but the phone was constantly in Roaming. We called tech support only to find out that this phone only works on the T-Mobile network. We're leaving boost mobile for another carrier. Other than that the phone is a typical Samsung device. It runs smooth, clear screen and works as it should. No complaints just be careful of your carrier before you order.

reviews.title:
2.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Misleading description not unlocked. Good looking phone
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2025
reviews.body: I recently purchased this phone, and I am very disappointed. The description of the phone is misleading, and the phone is not as advertised. The description claims that the phone is unlocked, but it is not. When I went to Metro, the representative looked up the IMEI and stated that the phone is locked and may have been refurbished. This is a big problem, because I need a phone right away, and all the local stores are out of stock for the Galaxy A15. I have requested a refund, but I have read other reviews that say it is taking longer than 30 days to process a refund for this same issue. I hope this will not be the case for me, because I feel that I should receive my refund as soon as they receive their product. I would like to be able to go to an actual store and purchase a phone without having to worry about this happening again. But the phone is very nice looking!

reviews.title:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Check with your cell phone service provider before buying this phone
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2024
reviews.body: I have MetroPCS by T-Mobile and the shop told me they would not be able to transfer my phone number to this phone. They said this happened with another customer who actually had the salesperson go through the attempt and the she was unable to make phone calls or receive calls with it. So the fact that this is an "unlocked phone" is no guarantee it will work with all carriers. He also said it is somewhere halfway between 3G and 4G. Not quite as good as most 4G phones but not quite as slow as 3G. If this is all you want you can buy a cheaper phone for a lot less money IMO.

3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Is usable
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2024
reviews.body: It took ten times for the phone to connect to my wi-fi so that I could set up the phone. It doesn't recognize my location, so the weather report doesn't apply to me. There were a couple of things in settings that buffered until the phone shut off, so I couldn't pursue those options. Since I only intend to use it for calls and texting, I'm keeping the phone. It's still amazing that this is a replacement phone, and it's still not performing as it is designed to do!

reviews.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great affordable phone
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2024
reviews.body: I got this to replace a 2-year-old Moto G power. The ratings and reviews said that the Samsung a15 had great battery life which is the single most important thing to me. I have been completely happy with this phone for a couple of weeks now. The screen is much brighter than most, which I like. I love many of the things Samsung has done with its software including adaptive screen brightness. It is a tremendous value. The only thing I'm not happy with is that when you use wired earbuds, the sound stutters at lower volumes unless it has a 3.5 mm plug with four sections instead of three. Earbuds with microphones have four sections. So I can't use my old earbuds, I ordered some new ones with microphones (and they work perfectly). Other than that, it is snappy, has plenty of RAM, plenty of storage, the fingerprint sensor works well, the cameras are pretty good and Samsung seems to be good about updates. Another of my essential criteria is no 5g. 5G is proven dangerous and I don't want to be anywhere near it. While this is 5G capable on certain networks, you can turn it off which is wonderful! You certainly can't go wrong for $170!

The data transfer was so easy and even brought in my apps & saved most of my progress on games. The screen quality and picture quality is excellent. My favorite feature is the speaker volume. My S9 was never loud enough and I find I have to turn down the top volume when using the speaker - it's too loud which is fantastic. I also like the fingerprint recognition being integrated with the power-on button.

    Pretty good phone

reviews.body: I have tested both AT&T, Verizon, and T-Mobile SIM card and they all work. Phone does not support eSIM, but does have NFC for contactless payment so Google or Samsung Pay works just fine. Phone also has 90 Hz refresh rate which allows navigating on it pretty smooth. Good phone with micro SD Card support.
